turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Randall Raines ... It's been a long time ...  frowns) 'though I do I recall you as a man with style. You remember your old friend, Atley -- ?

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Now. Where were we? Oh, yes. Kip.

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: My point. Yes. Simple, really. I require the best. I insist on the best. I only engage the best.  Your brother. His friends. They came to me. They wanted my paper. He was your brother. You were the best. Now. They've brought so much goddamn heat down, I may not be able to fill this order. Which would be very bad for me. Which in turn, is very bad for them...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I could kill you. That occurred to me. When I first heard about this. That I would kill you ...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Grow up. You don't kill people like me. People like me die in their sleep at 87 ... Do you know why? Because if you did kill me, and everyone knew it was you - for the next ten years they'd be finding pieces of those you love scattered all over California ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I can come up with the front money. Pay you back...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Were it only that easy. I have obligations. The order needs to be filled...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: They gave you only four days?

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: They gave me two weeks. I wasted most of it with your brother and his crew, who not only lost what pitiful few they managed to boost, but also alerted the heat as to our endeavor, making this even more difficult to achieve ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I'm just here about my brother.

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: I knew you'd say that, too --

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Your brother has four days. Fifty cars. Five-zero. For that he gets 200 large ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: And if he doesn't make it -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: I don't want them hurt. Any of 'em...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: "don't want" the Dodgers to lose or the summer to end. But we don't get to choose these things...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: This is how you're spending my time? Having a sock hop?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Everyone know Ray Calitri? Pillar of the community ...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Look at this. A multi-generational gathering of scumbags ...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: I hope you know what you're doing. God help you if you don't ...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Well, well. You've caused quite a ruckus ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: This is number 50. We did it. It's over Where's the money ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You should never have gotten my brother and his friends involved ...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: But I had to. It was the only way to get to you --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Well, now, he's clear. And you'll stay away from him...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: I don't know about that, Randall. He did such a good job on this paper. And another one just came in ...

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Look at it. I can't very well make delivery of that thing ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You got no choice. It's over.

turns.speaker: CALITRI
turns.text: Fifty cars. Fifty cars by 8 AM Friday. Or Kip goes in that box. That was the deal ... Goddamn, it ... That was the deal ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Good. Cos you know how it plays. Six years ago, I let you go free. But the next time ... The next time sends you away for'a long, long while ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE DRYCOFF
turns.text: By the time you get out, asshole, there won't even be cars. We'll all be cruisin' around in space ships ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE DRYCOFF
turns.text: They just brought in Donny Astricky. Shot by a jacker ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE DRYCOFF
turns.text: He'll live. But it means your boy's behind it. Astricky was holding a list. They just faxed it to us...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Let's get out there. And have them run down every 167 Shelby Mustang in the area ... Find out where they're at.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: You spend enough time down a man's throat, you get to know his tonsils. Do it ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: You want to come along quiet?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Leg's all banged-up. He made a stupid play ... He'll limp around the yard up at Folsom. But Astricky will be there to take care of him. With their priors, they're looking at a serious bounce --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Let them go. And I'll leave ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You don't have anything on me. A misdee auto-theft. I got no record. I'll be out in three days, and back at it. Or you let them go, and I give you my word. I'm gone. And without the ringleader ... Your tee-times have just grown exponentially...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Get out of here, then. Now.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: I remember us having made some kind of deal, Randall. I don't remember this deal having some kind of time-limit. I look at you - here - in my town - and I'm confused...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: I hope it's not your dear sweet mother...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Or your baby brother. What was his name?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Yes, Kip. Short for Kipling. Named for the English writer of stories about India ... He bites into his pear ... Memphis says nothing, waits ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: And this has what to do with me?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: I don't know. But you shouldn't be here. Take care of your business. I'll give you 24 hours. And then I don't want to see your face. Ever again. Make a fool of me once, that's my bad. Make a fool of me twice. That's really my bad, and I'll kick your ass from here to India ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: What are you still doing here, Randall?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Stopped by to see Otto. Say hello.

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You're thinking: okay, there's no want ... But they probably stripped its guts and crated 'em up, right ... ?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: It's funny. There's probably been five more cars stolen in the time I've been here ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Yet your still here ... I gave you 24 hours, 24 hours ago ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Honestly? I want to - once every few months - get into my car. Pack a lunch. And drive on up to Chino. On visiting day. Bring you some magazines. Maybe some almond clusters. And see you all bright and shiny in your orange jumpsuit. That's what I want ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: I want you gone, Randall. Settle your affairs. Make it right with those you love. Hell, take 'em with you. But I want you out of here. Out of here for good this time ...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: No faith in our new-found goodness, Detective ...?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Sure. But sometimes we got to create some numbers. The task force is run by statistics, you know ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
turns.text: Okay, then. I'll catch you later, Randall ...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE DRYCOFF
turns.text: When'd you get to town, Raines?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: No particular reason. Catch a Laker game. I heard we got Shaquille ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Just out there. Roaming around. Building up my collection of refrigerator magnets ...

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: Well, that defies the point, don't it?

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: You'll get the hang of it, kid. You just need to remember one thing -

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: You got a school teacher or Nancy from accounting, you don't put on Sly Stone or James Brown. You put on Ravel. Rachmaninoff. But if you got some wild one you just picked up at the track, you wouldn't put on Cat Stevens or James Taylor. You'd put on Prince. Or Isaac Hayes. Or, if you really wanted to get after it: Miles.

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: It's the same way with cars. Different cars. Different tunes. You can't steal a Maserati listening to Sinatra. You gotta get urgent. You gotta get Sonny Rollins or Led Zeppelin IV, on that shit. But never, never-ever take no Allman Brothers into a Lincoln Town Car. Could lead to disaster. Got it... ?

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: Very good. Think you can get in without waking her up -- ?

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: That's an after-market alarm. Can't just cut her wires ...

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: So? Tell me: how come they call you "Freb" anyways -- ?

turns.speaker: FREB
turns.text: You ever feel bad about any of this?

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: Of course not. I'm Robin Hood. I take from the rich, and give to the needy...

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: No. The needy. Us. Cos we need this car!

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: Lazy ... Lazy ... I ask you, Freb: what's the matter with kids today?

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: You guys have any skills at all?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Hell, yeah. Mirror Man here is our electronics expert. He's got some gadgets you old farts maybe never -heard of; Tumbler can drive anything with wheels, and some things without; Toby's a hacker, can do things with a computer, that are pretty amazing ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Freb can order pizzas like nobody's business

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: All I get are the Orientals. They can build 'em, but they can't drive 'em So? What are you doing here? What's with the outfit -- ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You know where the others are?

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: Okay. Figure it forgotten. What's this about anyways -- ?

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: We'll have to start beating the bushes, find out where they live...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Okay, okay. The important thing to remember, is to Think Slow. Take your time. It may not seem like it, but the night is long. Long enough. Just think slow and think smart...

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: A bunch of strung-out hypes and stick- up men. This ain't like the old days, Memphis. The profession has lost its..

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: We're on a truncated time-table. Take a day to shop it; a day to prep it ... And we're still going to need to expand the crew...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: We've got several Italian cars on the list. Always tricky, always timeconsuming. So we're gonna need a specialist ...

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: Jesus. The whole damn thing's loaded.

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: Yes, I do, in fact. John Wayne in McO...

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: That's being obscurest ... Who else? Better known. Memphis?

turns.speaker: DONNY ASTRICKY
turns.text: Walked like a bastard... Skippin' stones and shit..

turns.speaker: FREB
turns.text: The corner of Hawthorne and Granvia. Tumbler messed up. He said the Lotus would be at the corner of Hawthorne and Granvia --

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: He didn't mess up. There it is ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Pop the trunk. I need my tool ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: No ... And they won't take my calls ...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: It ain't what you'd call a "good sign"

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: That can't be it. Cos we don't need saving

turns.speaker: FREB
turns.text: Okay, okay. What about MAGNUM P.I.?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Thanks for playing, Freb. That's a gimme ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Atley Jackson came to see me ...

turns.speaker: HELEN RAINES
turns.text: Atley Jackson. How is that one? How's the leg... ?

turns.speaker: HELEN RAINES
turns.text: I couldn't. I didn't want you to worry. I thought held sort himself out. I hardly see him. He comes and goes. He's in trouble, isn't he?

turns.speaker: HELEN RAINES
turns.text: I knew it. He's changed, Randall. He's a different boy. He's lost that... That sweetness ... It's gone ... And I don't know what to do ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: He doesn't return my calls. or my letters ...

turns.speaker: HELEN RAINES
turns.text: Kipling was sixteen when you left, baby. I don't know what you remember of him. But you should brace yourself

turns.speaker: HELEN RAINES
turns.text: The photo album. I get nostalgic around this time of year ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You ever wonder what things'd be like if he hadn't died?

turns.speaker: HELEN RAINES
turns.text: Every day. I wonder about that every day...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Kip and I'd probably be working at the dealership...  Imagine us selling cars?

turns.speaker: HELEN RAINES
turns.text: And just in case you lose your keys, good sir, I can toss in a complimentary slim-jim, free of charge ...

turns.speaker: HELEN RAINES
turns.text: I remember. Supper getting cold, cos you two are out there heads under hoods ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: We do it. He'll get clear Once and for all

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: D.W.P. Thanks for holding. How can I help you?

turns.speaker: JUDGE CROFT
turns.text: I got a message. I live at 1443 Locklin.

turns.speaker: JUDGE CROFT
turns.text: NO! No, I can't! I'm a busy man.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: okay, sir. Let me just get the-order. Yes. We'll be doing some work out your way. We've got a power leak. And it's unsafe. We're moving residences to the... Marriott Long Beach ... Just for the night ...

turns.speaker: JUDGE CROFT
turns.text: Okay, then ... I just go to the Marriott and I'm set ...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: "Carol." A 198 Mercedes ... She lives in the suburbs ...

turns.speaker: OTTO
turns.text: It's ear-marked for Mirror Man and The Sphinx...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: How'd you get here? Your Moms give you ride -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: You boosted a 'Vette? Then where is it?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I dunno. It was right here. Someone musta' boosted it back...

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: It looks just like a regular Mustang --

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: What am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: It's good to see ya, man. You changed your look -

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I think so. There's things I can't feel right now. Like my feet. But ... You think you can get me outta this, Memphis? I'd appreciate it -

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: This has nothing to do with any of that --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Oh. You maybe have more than one enemy who owns a car-crusher -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: All my enemies own car crushers. It's like a pre-requisite ... Owwww...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: Easy ... Take it easy ... We're almost there...

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Totally. I'm fine. You want a beer, man -- ?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Yeah, man. Where is your beer?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Cool. So you're living up North?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I heard you were pumping gas -

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: You're kind of cultivating a new look.

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Hey, you want something to eat ?

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: There's certainly a time and a place for a mellow olive -

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. That's what I'm thinking --

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: So what are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: About Calitri? No worries, man. I'll call him. He's a reasonable dude ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: You just got crushed in a car. You're bleeding all over your self. And you sit there - eating olives and talking basketball, as if, at this very moment, people weren't plotting your demise ...

turns.speaker: MEMPHIS
turns.text: "Over--"  You know - I can maybe understand, since I been gone, you taking up this dumb-ass life of crime, and for that I can partly blame myself. But what is baffling to me, is how, since I been gone, you've become a complete and total moron--
